DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study assess disease-free survival 4.5 year postoperatively woman apparent Stage 1 endometrial cancer , compare patient randomise receive Total Laparoscopic Hysterectomy ( TLH ) patient randomise receive Total Abdominal Hysterectomy ( TAH ) .
DOC.detailed_description: This phase III international , multicenter , open-label , randomized clinical trial equivalence study hypothesis Total Laparoscopic Hysterectomy ( TLH ) associate equivalent disease-free survival compare standard treatment Total Abdominal Hysterectomy ( TAH ) woman apparent Stage I endometrial cancer . The secondary hypothesis : - TLH associate equivalent improve Quality Life ( QoL ) 6 month ; - TLH associate reduce treatment-related morbidity ; - TLH associate short hospital stay ; - TLH associate less analgesic consumption ; - TLH cost effective ; - TLH associate improved pelvic floor function .
DOC.criteria: Patients may include study must follow : Histologically confirm primary endometrioid adenocarcinoma endometrium ; Clinical stage I disease ; ECOG Performance status 01 ; Signed write informed consent ; Females , age 18 year old . Patients exclude participate study following : Other histologic type endometrioid adenocarcinoma endometrium ; Clinically advance disease ( stage IIIV ) ; Uterine size large 10 week gestation ; Estimated life expectancy le 6 month ; Enlarged aortic lymph node ; Unfit Surgery : serious concomitant systemic disorder incompatible study ( discretion investigator ) ; Patient compliance geographic proximity allow adequate followup ; Unfit complete QoL measurement .
